paragraph.paragraph:
A debugger is a tool that allows you to
10_execution/00_introduction.xml run an application and view its state at any moment. This includes having information concerning the current
30_call_stack_tool/00_introduction.xml call stack and the
40_object_tool/00_introduction.xml state of objects of the system, i.e. the values of their attributes. This kind of information can be used to spot objects that have invalid states, to see the consequences of the execution of a feature over an object state, and so on.
The features of the EiffelStudio debugger include:

list.item: Stopping the application in frozen features as well as in melted features

10_execution/40_step_into_a_feature.xml Stepping into features,
10_execution/50_step_by_step.xml executing them one line at a time , or
10_execution/60_step_out.xml stepping out of them

Setting
20_breakpoints/00_introduction.xml breakpoints on-the-fly, while the execution is running

Classes can implement the
40_object_tool/17_debug_output.xml debug_output interface and have their objects display a string in the debugger

Execution can be recorded to be replayed when execution is paused, use the
35_execution_record_and_replay/index.xml execution replay mechanism from the call stack tool interface, and have the debugging tools updated.

Debuggee objects can be stored/retrieved from the debugger, check the
52_debuggee_object_storage.xml debuggee object storage mechanism available from the objects tool, and watch tools' toolbar.
